alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 9:39PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wayne, northern Sampson and southeastern Johnston Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 938 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Dunn, or 16 miles northwest of Clinton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, frequent lightning, and winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Newton Grove, Seven Springs, Hobbton, Mar-Mac, Brogden, Spivey`s Corner, Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park and Grantham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter.
